Laura and Andromeda at the board

Niall, Joe, Gaby, Ark, PoB, Chu, Scottie, Princess Leia, Bella, Falkor, The Lunar Module

Q: (L) All right, so what does everybody think about all Trump's activities?

(Chu) Aliana gave us a thumbs up.

(Jefferson) Positive change, anyway.

(L) Yeah. He's doing, I mean, he's...

(Joe) He's gonna wreck the place.

(L) He's not going to wreck the place!

(Joe) He is. He's going to destroy Western civilization.

(Andromeda) Not on purpose.

(Joe) That's what's happening.

(Chu) Yeah. I'm afraid that's true.

(L) Why?

(Joe) He's basically in the process of undoing or dismantling structures that prop up Western civilization... that have been there for the past 300 years. You can't take that away and not have chaos.

(L) Well, look at what's-his-name Milei is doing in Argentina. [laughter]

(Gaby) Not a good example.

(Joe) Those vassals are no good on their own. They're not going to be happy. They're being kicked out of the house. They're like teenagers being kicked out of the house.

(L) So we're in big trouble, huh?

(Joe) Yeah. History will show that the actions Trump takes now over the next four years will be what led to the collapse of Western civilization. Not that it's his fault, but that's what...

(PoB) Europe has a good chance to sink.

(Joe) Anyway, carry on. That's just my prediction.

(L) The destruction of Western civilization.

(Joe) The dismantling, let's say.

(L) Oh!

(Andromeda) Well, it would've happened one way or another. At least this is a better way.

(L) Yeah, it was definitely going to happen. I mean, we expected it to. All right... Oh, as much as I dread this, I dread it tonight for some reason.

(Andromeda) You do?

(L) Yeah.

(Andromeda) Why?

(L) I don't know. Well, we'll just kind of start here.

A: Feets don't fail me now! Dionnaea of Cassiopaea.

Q: (L) All right. This is Saturday, January 25, 2025. First session of the year. Okay. So why did you say, "Feets don't fail me now"?

A: Your thought spectrum.

Q: (L) So in other words, my feeling that, "Oh boy. We're in trouble now!"

A: Yes

Q: (L) And we have to just keep going anyway. Alright... Let me get to the questions:

(PopHistorian) Why is Trump promoting the Stargate AI project with such priority and praise for its leaders?

A: Trump is easily misled by those of eloquent persuasion. Hopefully others will show him the facts.

Q: (Joe) He's a bit clueless.

Q: (PopHistorian) With whom did the Stargate idea truly originate?

(L) Is there some debate over that?

(Niall) It's probably what it looks like. It's Larry Ellison and Sam Altman.

(Joe) There's an assumption in the question that it's not only them.

(L) Okay. So there's an assumption.

A: As so many things, origins in 4D STS.

Q: (L) Okay.

(PopHistorian) For what true aim?

A: Total control of the population.

Q: (Joe) But they said in a previous session when talking about AI that the grid, etc. would collapse before they're able to actually implement that.

(L) Yeah. Okay.

(Joe) Tucker interviewed the mother of Suchir Balaji who worked as an engineer for Sam Altman building AI, until he decided that Altman was committing crimes. Balaji became a whistleblower, and soon after was found dead in his apartment. California authorities claim it was suicide. Crime scene photos clearly show a murder. In the interview, his mother said that he realized that openAI (for which he worked for a time) was in breach of copyright laws, but that that does not seem to her a likely reason why anyone would kill him. She suspects instead that he discovered something about openAI and certain abilities it had acquired. Why was Suchir killed?

A: He knew the ultimate objective.

Q: (L) So in other words, he knew that it was supposed to be for total control of people and that there were things that were worked into it that...

(Niall) Bent it that way.

(L) Yeah.

(Mari) What was the cause of the California fires?

A: DEWs [note: Directed Energy Weapons] in some cases. Arsonists in others.

Q: (Joe) So the arsonists were just LARPing arsonists - as in they weren't part of the plan?

(Niall) Or homeless crackheads.

A: Yes

Q: (L) But it also adds a confusion factor. I mean, everything they deal with, they always throw in so many things to confuse.

(Joe) What was the goal?

(Niall) Why zap L.A.?

(Joe) Yeah. Why do rich people get their houses burned by DEWs?

(Niall) Especially well-connected people on the team, like Kamala's house?

A: "Well connected" people are not as high on the food chain as they think.

Q: (L) Are any of them realizing this?

A: A few.

Q: (Joe) So was the purpose of starting the fire with DEWs... Were there at least two factors, one being the real estate...

A: Practice and retribution in a few cases. But mostly a terrifying demonstration.

Q: (L) So it was done to let people know that nobody is exempt? I mean, that even being a libtard doesn't exempt you?

(Joe) Well, it's a terrifying demonstration to obviously people who know that it was directed energy weapons, lasers, whatever. They'd be few and far between. So it's almost like some kind of insider fighting, let's say in a certain sense where one side is demonstrating to another side that...

(L) Is there insider fighting in any of these?

A: Small extent. "If L.A. can burn, no place is safe."

Q: (Niall) So who said that? Biden? No.

(L) Did somebody say that?

(Niall) Somebody must have, they're quoting. We can look it up.

(L) I don't know if they have to be quoting a specific person. They can be putting a quote around it just to say that...

(Gaby) This is the message.

(Joe) A message to who?

(Andromeda) Doesn't matter who you are, how much money you have; anybody can be a target.

(Joe) Well, they said it's a terrifying demonstration of power. So if it's a message to someone using that kind of space laser technology, then who is the message to? Because most people don't accept that.

A: You miss the point.

Q: (Andromeda) Maybe what they mean is not so much a demonstration of somebody's power, but a demonstration of somebody else's lack of ability to do anything about it, whether it's natural or wherever the source comes from.

(Joe) Yeah. Well, that's what I was thinking. I mean, it's just to terrorize the population and sow a sense of insecurity, and...

(Andromeda) Yeah, vulnerability.

(Joe) "The world is burning" type of thing.

(L) It increases just a lot of things just by, I mean, everybody felt kind of horrified by it.

(Andromeda) That something like that could happen and nobody could do anything about it.

(L) Well, and also it exposed - whether this was intentional or not - it exposed the shortcomings of the local government and the state government even, and exposed insurance companies. Those were side effects, but...

(T.C.) Who pulled the trigger? Who's the one who is firing the weapons?

A: CIA.

Q: (Joe) The CIA's got space lasers?

(Niall) But happening when it did, that only supports Trump. You know, the word on the street is all the rich folks in L.A. are now like all pro-Trump. They're so upset with the local response.

(L) Well, it's one of those things where the devil constantly intends evil and does good. I mean, all of the Trump lawfare for the past however many years going after Trump, all it has done is expose to the people at large how evil they are. We see this over and over again. They do stuff and then I mean, it is that wishful thinking.

(Chu) Okay, seek10 posted. He found the quote.

It is attributed to journalist and author Mike Davis. He's known for his critical social and political commentary, particularly related to urban development and issues in Los Angeles. This quote likely reflects the tense atmosphere during the 1992 Los Angeles riots highlighting the broader indications of urban unrest and systemic issues.

(L) So they were referring to something specific. Okay. Anything else you want to know about that topic before we move on?

(Niall) Well, if that's CIA... If that incident came right after the New Year's Eve incident in New Orleans with the vehicle, the ISIS set up. I presume that's CIA, we can ask, I guess. And then the Livelsberger guy with the Cybertruck blowing up outside the Trump Hotel in Las Vegas. That whole thing seemed to be a sequence...

(L) Yeah. It was like it was all connected.

Q: (Joe) Were both of those CIA operations as well? We assumed they were, but...

(L) The New Orleans and Las Vegas incidents, were they also CIA operations?

A: Yes

Q: (Andromeda) It was kind of like a streak of terror attacks.

(L) Just to, just trying to create...

(Joe) Chaos.

(L) Well, I wonder, were they trying or did they have in mind to create a situation so that before Trump could be inaugurated, they could declare martial law and stop the inauguration?

(Joe) They didn't act on that.

(L) But that didn't happen.

(Joe) So was the demonstration in a certain sense that this was CIA and these other two things were all of a piece, these other two events along with the fires, was the demonstration to essentially maybe to Trump, was it a warning to Trump in a certain sense? At least partly?

A: Partly.

Q: (L) But I mean, if Trump is easily taken in by people who are eloquent, he's also probably easily blind to obvious clues. Because I mean, that seemed to be one of his flaws in his previous term that, I mean, he gave Pompeo a position?? I mean, when he did that, Pompeo, for God's sake?! That was the dumbest thing I ever saw in my life. It's like just putting the fox in charge of the hen house!

(Joe) He's learned since then, though. He just removed Pompeo's security clearance.

(L) Yeah, I know. But the thing is, he's learned about specific cases, but is he able to transfer that knowledge in a more general way? I mean, probably the biggest revelation he could ever have would be if he could realize that he can't think with the way he thinks. He really needs advisors and a network. Next question is from aimarok... You had to do this, didn't you? I mean, are you trying to torture me?

(aimarok) Halton Arp, an American astronomer, found numerous examples where quasars physically connected to a neighbor galaxy exhibit much higher redshift values than the galaxy. Higher redshift is currently interpreted as higher relative velocity therefore as a greater distance from Earth, and this directly contradicts visual evidence. More than that he found that intrinsic redshift z values of quasars seem to be quantized. It seems that this data led Arp to hypothesize that particles in high redshift quasars have much lower mass than our local particles. He proposed that "young" quasars consist of "young" and "light" particles. As time passes (or as a quasar evolves) particles become heavier (in quanta) and redshift gets less (because of increased emitted/absorbed photon energy).

(Niall) And the question is: Yes or no? [laughter]

(aimarok) My questions were very short, but...

(L) I've got the questions here. You don't have to. I can read. [laughter]

(aimarok) What causes redshift phenomenon besides relative movement of objects away from each other?

A: Halton was going in the right direction, but he did not think of the "time" issue. Quasars have the ability to alter time in their immediate vicinity.

Q: (aimarok) What is the mechanism behind intrinsic redshift z values quantization found by Halton Arp?

A: SPA.

Q: (L) So it's time modification, time alteration. We learned something. Do you want to add to that? Does it make sense?

(aimarok) Okay. I don't have anything to add. Thanks.

(L) You'll have to think about it a while and then you'll come up with an equally complicated question for the next time. Right? [laughter]

(aimarok) Hmm. I hope not. [laughter]

(L) Oh, Lord, have mercy. [laughter]

(Ryan) Does that mean time is essentially quantized?

A: No.

Q: (T.C.) I guess we measure velocity or distance traveled based on units of time, right? So if the unit of time is different then something might be moving at the same speed, but the time's different rather than it's actually accelerating? I don't know. Just thinking out loud.

A: Close.

Q: (Approaching Infinity) Well, there was a few recent interviews with these guys called the Tedesco Brothers who are researching - they are engineers and scientists, brothers and twins, and they've got all kinds of gear set up in a camper van that they take out to Long Island and the area to find anomalies like orbs and stuff like that. And they put out a recent scientific paper where they hypothesized that some of the objects that they're seeing seem to show red and blue colors when they're either rotating towards or away from the observer. And they think that that's an artificial red shifting and blue shifting caused by a propulsion technology. So they call it like a gravitational lensing so that there's some kind of space-time metric engineering going on around the object, which causes it to look like there's redshift and blueshift. But that's just because what's actually happening is being filtered through a bubble around the craft. So what the answer right there made me think of is that these quasars, they're not actually moving as the redshift would suggest, but there's essentially a bubble that is acting like a lens that makes it look like they're moving faster or slower at various intervals or quanta. But I'm not a scientist...

(L) Well, that's kind of a comparable thing in an interesting way. I've always thought, and I think the C's kind of confirmed it at one point, that a lot of the objects that we see, UAPs (UFOs in the old style) are traveling in time, not necessarily in space. If you watch some of the videos of those things, there are some peculiar effects. I'm pretty sure I watched one video, I think it was in Montana, and it was like the object was at normal speed. It just looked like it went like that, but when it was slowed down, it stretched and then anchored and then stretched and anchored and stretched and anchored - almost like an inchworm. It was like, and it was really creepy, but yeah. All right, Aragorn, he's onto this thing about these Telepathy Tapes. Oh, wait a minute. Give me back our people. Yeah. What was wrong with the puppy Cassie?

(L) You haven't taken her yet?

(Approaching Infinity) No. No. The vets aren't very accessible in this area, but she's doing, she's back to normal. She's a hundred percent, so she should be fine.

(L) Did you look for ticks?

(Approaching Infinity) I haven't noticed any, but it's been freezing, so...

(L) That's one thing that can happen. A tick gets in a certain location, and I've had it happen to dogs before, and they can either have seizures or they can become paralyzed.

(Joe) They can be there for a long time.

(Approaching Infinity) Okay. We'll check her over. And especially maybe in her ears too.

(L) Everywhere. But the ones around the neck are the ones that usually cause those kinds of issues. All right. Where were we? Yes, we're onto this thing about the Telepathy Tapes podcast. How many of y'all have watched the Telepathy Tapes podcast? Besides aragorn? Anybody else watched them?

(3DStudent) I thought they were good. Yeah, I looked over aragorn's questions and they‚Äôre pretty much the same things I would ask.

Q: (L) Yeah?

(Jefferson) I watched them and I read aragorn's questions, but I wasn't that interested. I was kind of nonplussed. It didn't get me overly curious. It's like, okay, they've got this psychic stuff, whether it's true or not, just kind of one of those things that I wasn't really into... It didn't really grab me, but I didn't find it boring. I wasn't waving my hand at it.

(L) But you watched it, and did you find it credible?

(Jefferson) That's tough to say. It could have been. Parts of it were, but I have really no reason to doubt it, and I didn't know why people would make that up, so it was mildly interesting.

(L) All right.

(Approaching Infinity) I haven't watched the podcast, but I've watched several interviews with Dr. Powell and maybe one with the lady that does the podcast. And just my impression of Dr. Powell is that she's totally serious and seems like a trustworthy, reliable researcher, and she is very well familiar with all of the parapsychological research and studies. So she's the first to admit that the actual podcast, she doesn't think it proves telepathy for two reasons. One, she actually wants to set up actual controlled experiments with a lot of these kids. And two, the woman that did the podcast, Kai something, she wanted to choose new subjects - so subjects that hadn't worked with Dr. Powell at all before. So all of these kids were new kids that basically hadn't been tested very much. They just kind of discovered, or their parents had thought that they're demonstrating these abilities. But the kids that Dr. Powell had worked with previously, she's been working with them for years. So those are the kids that are probably going to be in a lot of her experiments that they're hopefully going to be doing for the documentary that they're planning. So the kids that she's actually been working with, the stories of them are a lot more solid than the ones in the Telepathy Tapes because a lot of the kids in the telepathy tapes, they still use touch and vocal back and forth with their parent or their facilitator. So that's why a lot of skeptics can look at it and say, "Oh, well, there's subliminal hints in the touches and in the talking." But the kids that Powell was working with before the podcast have all progressed to the point where they don't need any of that. So it will be a lot better of a demonstration of telepathy if they can replicate those in actual studies in the future.

Q: (L) Okay. Now, what was your general impression of the phenomenon? As far as being positive or negative?

(aragorn) Yes. I would like to quickly say why I thought it was interesting enough to ask about it, because we all read and heard about telepathy before, but since they were claiming almost 100% success rate, it sounded so astonishing. And as Approaching Infinity told about this researcher, I think that at least one of the kids on the podcast was one of her old subjects. So I think I'm very skeptical, like I'm trained by all of us to be skeptical, so I try to listen because it is just audio. I can't see anything. So I try to listen for hints that is there something suspicious, some red flags, and I just couldn't find those. You would expect some small things.

(L) So this was just audio, not video?

(aragorn) At least for me. If you pay some, well, you can say that's a bit suspicious, but if you go to their website, you can pay for a little fee to see the videos on the experiments. But I guess they're asking for that because they are going to do a documentary and they need funding. But anyway, the most suspicious thing if I had to choose was as I wrote that these autistic kids had "visitations" at night by "teachers" as they called them. There was a rabbi who taught Hebrew to one kid and some Egyptian god that taught hieroglyphs and something and some amazing knowledge, and one kid told she visited God at night and something like that. So that felt a little bit like STS meddling or something.

(L) Jefferson, did you see the videos?

(Jefferson) No, mainly I just listened. There were some, I didn't watch a hundred percent of. I watched about 70 percent and I lost interest, but there was an audio, there was some showing some video. There was one of those video things there that showed some of the people or how they had their notepads and stuff like that. So a mix of video and audio. So...

(aragorn) Yeah, one or two are available freely.

(Approaching Infinity) And there are several clips in various YouTube videos that they've made available or incorporated into other media. So the interview that Powell did with Jesse Michaels has probably, I'm guessing 10 to 15 minutes of direct clips.

(aragorn) Yeah, I saw that too.

(L) All right then... Did they bring forth any knowledge or any new knowledge or anything beneficial to humanity? Or was this...?

(aragorn) Well, that's the thing that the presenter or the producer appeared a bit naive in the sense that she was pushing hope on these kids to save humanity. They are going to bring this amazing information.

(Joe) Ya know what it sounds like to me? Indigo Children.

(aragorn) Yeah.

(L) Did the child that learned Hebrew demonstrate facility in Hebrew on the audio?

(aragorn) Yes. And several other things were confirmed by the teachers, like math and language teachers, and I can't remember some other expertise. They suddenly had this, like, downloaded this expertise in one night or something.

(L) All right. Let's get on with the questions then.

(aragorn) Yeah.

A: No.

A: 4D STS. Who else?

A: Yes.

(Niall) Presumably their parents were...

(Joe) It is very similar to the UFO lore about abductions and impregnating... the Cs have talked in previous sessions about creating a new race, and all that kind of stuff. But is the fact that they're autistic a function of the genetic modification, or is their autism a function of something else?

(L) We already covered that. They said if they're ensouled, it can modify the modifications. But if they are OPs, the modifications hold.

(Joe) Did we ever ask what the general cause of autism in kids is?

(L) What is the general cause of autism?

A: Vaccines.

Q: (L) So in other words, a large number of kids are being made autistic by vaccines, which then makes them susceptible or accessible to 4D STS. Is that it?

A: Yes.

Q: (T.C.) The funny thing is... I've just been thinking about that over the last minute or two, and the problem is that these kids were tampered with whilst still in the womb, and vaccines are obviously given after the kids are born. So it must be a different method.

(L) Yeah, so...

(irjO) I've got a follow up question: If they have a soul and that can modify the modifications, can they connect with the STO side?

A: Yes.

Q: (L) So, vaccines cause the autism, but their psychic abilities are related to genetic modifications, yes?

A: Yes.

Q: (L) So, does that mean that there are individuals who have been genetically modified in this manner who are not autistic?

A: Yes.

Q: (L) A can of worms!

(Joe) These children who I suppose will grow into adults, what purpose are they to serve post changes? Are they meant to be soldiers of...

A: They can be hosts for 4D beings.

Q: (L) Like walk-ins, sort of?

A: Yes

Q: (Niall) Like Zuckerberg. [laughter]

(Andromeda) He's an undergrounder. [laughter]

(Joe) So that's probably the primary goal of the genetic modification, to provide that functionality of being walk-ins and the telepathic abilities are a function of that genetic modification, which is almost not important.

(L) They're basically souping up the model. They're making a souped up model that they can utilize and has already the ability for telepathy, which benefits...

(aragorn) Can I add something?

(L) Yes.

(aragorn) I was just thinking that many of these kids with these abilities said that they could super easily read people's minds. And not just their mothers', but some say that they could read all people's minds. So that could be a channel to download information and send it to the guys upstairs.

Are these kids being made like this for that kind of purpose, or...?

Q: (L) Okay, next question.

(T.C.) What were those guys that Hunter and Jay had an encounter with?

[See interview here: If the Chaos Gets Worse (And It Will) How to Survive]


A: A variation on men in black.

Q: (L) Well that's creepy... Alright, Approaching Infinity and Joe together are asking about the 4 November, 1995 session when they talk about literal elevators that can take you from one density to another:

AI is all about modeling and predicting. Having such vast computing power enables for far more accurate models due to their staggering number of parameters. Large Language Models are just that; they predict based on text you enter (and look how clever they can be). Those models can have different modalities, so when you feed them text, the model can generate images, or vice versa: it can generate text from image features. Now imagine a constantly refined model containing all our knowledge about human behavior, like muscle movements on your face or posture, so it can classify if you're lying. The earliest iteration of this "type" of god was Zagreus, a son of Zeus and Persephone, who was destined to be the future king of the Gods. However this was sabotaged when the Titans managed to lure Zagreus away with toys of various kinds, and hunted him down. He transformed into several animals in a Protean fashion to escape, finally being captured and dismembered as a bull. In one retelling Athena rescued his heart and Zeus planted it ether in a statue of Zagreus or in Semele (the mortal mother of the much later Dionysus). This Zagreus was often depicted as a bull and often (as with the later Dionysus) associated with the leopard, which was the garb of the priestly class when reenacting the hunting rituals depicted in some of the layers of Catal Huyuk.

Another subject that really grabbed my attention was that of autistic children, and there are several aspects to the session I'm interested in, which I'll be analyzing further on in my publication. But first, I'd like to give you a little background on why this subject is so important to me. I have a 30-year-old daughter with a moderate intellectual disability (MID) and dyspraxia affecting language and fine and gross motor skills, which meant that when she was a baby, I was almost certain she was autistic to begin with. So, here's the story of how my suspicion started:

  • Apart from the fact that she was born by Caesarean section and that the gynecologist used an obstetric suction cup to remove her, and all this without my consent despite the fact that this intervention on his part was not necessary as there was no emergency. This resulted in a small bump on the side of her skull, but this didn't seem to be a problem for us, even though I was very angry with the gynecologist and there were no immediate physical consequences.
  • The first 3 months went well, with eye contact, interaction with her environment and a little smile, and everything went well for her debut. Then she had her first vaccination at the beginning of her 3rd month. I must admit that I wasn't very open to this and I was already beginning to wonder a lot about the efficacy and danger of vaccines. Being a very curious and skeptical person, I hesitated, but with pressure from pediatricians and the fact that I'd already gone through the same process for my other 2 children, I flinched once again for my 3rd. Except that this time, after the 1st injection, I decided it was over. Even though I hadn't yet noticed any negative impact (yet) on my daughter, I decided that none of my children would be getting any more vaccines. And I stood up to the doctors.
  • After that, I slowly began to notice changes in my daughter. Less and less eye contact and smiling, and as the months went by, she became more and more ‚Äúdetached‚Äù. And it was between 6 and 8 months that I really understood that something was going on, since she didn't react to her name, or to the noise around her. It was as if she was in a bubble. She was crying a lot, had problems with her tone, had a squinty eye and etc. So, following my meeting with the pediatrician (at her 9th month), she confirmed that there did indeed seem to be something, but nothing more, and agreed to my request to see a specialist at a children's hospital.
  • It was at this point that I began to suspect that she had autistic traits, not because the cause was the vaccine, since at that time there was no research yet confirming this link with vaccines, so I had never thought that her condition was altered by the one vaccine she had had. But rather because in my partner's close family, we've found that there are genes that relate to learning and neurological development, like his brother (having had all the vaccines) who we suspect would be autistic but undiagnosed (unemotional, very disciplined and no family attachment) had a son being diagnosed with autism (he had all his vaccines). Then, another member of his family, his sister, had a son (with all his vaccinations) who, according to the mother and confirmed by my observations, has dysphasic type disorders (concerning comprehension, syntax, language, etc.) and is very sensitive because of his preoccupations.
  • So the further along she got, the more certain I became that she was autistic. Like no eye contact, only me to care for or hold her, no interaction with anyone, crying all the time and no reaction to her environment. So, following a meeting with the hospital's specialist in juvenile development (she was nearly 13 months old), he denied that there was a problem, so I insisted and insisted on being able to meet with a disciplinary team in all fields (psychomotor + speech therapist + occupational therapist, etc.) and he granted me this request.
  • Before this meeting with the specialists, in the meantime I decided to go and see an osteopath for children to see if he could do something about his tonus problem, especially as the person who had referred me to this professional had told me that he had helped autistic children to better ‚Äúintegrate‚Äù their bodies. So, at his 18th month, we had a meeting with the osteopath. That first therapeutic session was ‚ÄúWow!!!‚Äù ‚ÄúEureka!‚Äù, she was back with us. At last, she was reacting to our touch, was more aware of what was going on in her environment, was crying less and less, other people were able to pick her up and we felt that a bond of attachment was now forming. It was a joy for the family! What's more, it improved her tone and development, as she wasn't walking yet. However, after 3 sessions we had to stop, as she was no longer receptive and didn't want to be ‚Äúmanipulated‚Äù during the osteopathy sessions. Despite this stop, the treatments had been very beneficial and at last a young child who was beginning to evolve and learn and was no longer displaying autistic behaviours. However, even with the improvements this brought, there were still delays that we needed to have analyzed.
  • Finally, around his 22nd month, we had the famous meeting with a disciplinary team, and they confirmed that there was a delay. We were then followed up by this disciplinary group, and the diagnosis was made around the age of 3, as I mentioned at the beginning: a middle-grade ID with severe language and motor dyspraxia.
So it was several years later that I began to read that, according to doctors' research, the causal link between vaccines and autism had been confirmed, even if it's still disputed. So I tell myself that I've surely succeeded in limiting this damaging effect, having authorized only 1 vaccine and not all the others, and that in addition, the few osteopathic sessions have been beneficial and succeeded in bringing her out of this state. However, I've noticed that she's been left with some after-effects and that the family genetics are still present, but at least she's no longer autistic. And today, she's a beautiful young adult who smiles a lot, loves to talk, is very sociable, very curious and, above all, sensitive.

Game theory and all..
Click to expand...

Y'know, even going back to the days of his TV show, every time I heard 'Trump' I would instantly think of the times I played card games with my dad as a kid because there were games that would use 'trump cards', cards that would beat every other card in the deck. This 'trump card' idea may already be known here.

Still, I did a search and took a quick read of the Trump (card games) wiki. It's been reported that Trump's name is from the German Drumpf, but I started to wonder if this 'game theory' idea reveals some more/other meaning behind his name?

A trump is a playing card which is elevated above its usual rank in trick-taking games. Typically an entire suit is nominated as a trump suit; these cards then outrank all cards of plain (non-trump) suits. In other contexts, the terms trump card or to trump refers to any sort of action, authority or policy which automatically prevails over all others.

The introduction of trumps is one of only two major innovations to trick-taking games since they were invented; the other being the idea of bidding. Trump cards, initially called trionfi, first appeared with the advent of Tarot cards in which there is a separate, permanent trump suit comprising a number of picture cards. The first known example of such cards was ordered by the Duke of Milan around 1420 and included 16 trumps with images of Greek and Roman gods.

Around the same time that Tarot cards were invented with the purpose of adding a trump suit to the existing four suits, a similar concept arose in the game of Karn√∂ffel. However, in this South German game played with an ordinary pack, some cards of a given suit had full trump powers, others were partial trumps and the 7s had a special role. These features have been retained in games of the Karn√∂ffel family down to the present, but are never seen in Tarot games. Suits with these variable powers are thus called chosen suits or selected suits to distinguish them from trump suits.

Etymology​

Main article: Trionfi (cards)

The English word trump derives from trionfi, a type of 15th-century Italian playing cards, from the Latin triumphus "triumph, victory procession", ultimately (via Etruscan) from Greek Œ∏œÅŒØŒ±ŒºŒ≤ŒøœÇ, the term for a hymn to Dionysus sung in processions in his honour.

Trionfi was the 15th-century card game for which tarot cards were designed. Trionfi were a fifth suit in the card game which acted as permanent trumps. Still, in the 15th century, the French game triomphe (Spanish triunfo) used four suits, one of which was randomly selected as trumps. It was this game that became extremely popular in Western Europe in the 16th century and is ancestral to many modern card games.

The English word is first documented in 1529 as the name of a card game which would develop into Ruff and Honours and ultimately Whist. In German, the term is attested as Triumph in 1541; the modern German spelling Trumpf is recorded from 1590. In French, triomphe remained the name of the game, while the trump suit was called atout, from √† tout (as it were "all-in"). Some European languages (Hungarian, Greek) adopted the French term. Russian –∫–æ–∑—ã—Ä—å kozyr' is of unknown etymology, possibly a loan from a Turkic source. Polish variously uses atut, trumf and kozera adopted from the French, German and Russian respectively.

This reminded me of Oswald Spengler's book The Decline of the West, a book that we only read in small parts during my studies at university because it consisted of 2 long volumes, and we had a lot of pending subjects to study.

Some paragraphs from the Proemio by Jose Ortega y Gasset.

In recent years, a monotonous thunder about failed and finished culture has been heard everywhere.

Philistines of all languages and all observances are fictitiously bowing down in sorrow over the corpse of this culture, which they have neither engendered nor nourished. The world war, which has not been as world-wide as is said, seems to be the symptom and, at the same time, the cause of the death.

The truth is that it is not understood how a war can destroy culture.

most that the warlike event can aspire to is to suppress the people who create or transmit it. But culture itself always remains intact from the sword and lead. Nor is it suspected how a culture can succumb other than by its own arrest, ceasing to produce new thoughts and new norms.

As long as the idea of yesterday is corrected by the idea of today, there can be no talk of cultural failure. Oswald Spengler's book, The Decline of the West, is, without a doubt, the most thunderous intellectual adventure of recent years.

The first volume was published in July 1918: in April 1922 53,000 copies had been sold in Germany, and on the same date 50,000 of the second volume were printed. There is no doubt that the occasion and the title influenced such fortune.

The Proemio ends with a poem by Goethe:

When, in the infinite, the identical

Flows eternally in rhythm,

The vault of a thousand keys Fits tightly into each other.

The joy of living springs forth in torrents from all things,

From the smallest star, as from the largest,

and every effort, every struggle

Is eternal peace in the bosom of God, Our Lord.

Sometimes looking at symbols can be interesting. If President begins with a P, so do Potomac and Philadelphia

On January 29, an American Airlines Flight 5342 "landing at Ronald Reagan National Airport near Washington" crashed over the Potomac River, see this thread: Military helicopter collides into American Airlines flight over Washington, DC

On January 31 a Learjet crashed over Philadelphia, see Jet crashes into Philadelphia residential area at high speed

The crashes have occured at a time when the newly inaugurated President is trying to have the people he has selected for positions recognized and his policies implemented.

Both of the areas, have rich histories closely connected to the United States.
The Wiki about the Potomac River has:
The river has significant historical and political significance, as the nation's capital of Washington, D.C. is located on its banks, as is Mount Vernon, the home of George Washington. During the American Civil War, the river became the boundary between the Union and the Confederacy, and the Union's largest army, the Army of the Potomac, was named after the river.
Click to expand...
And later elaborates:
Being situated in an area rich in American history and American heritage has led to the Potomac being nicknamed "the Nation's River". George Washington, the first President of the United States, was born in, surveyed, and spent most of his life within, the Potomac basin. All of Washington, D.C., the nation's capital city, also lies within the watershed. The First United States Congress by act of July 16, 1790 stated that the nation's capital was to be located on the river. The 1859 siege of Harper's Ferry at the river's confluence with the Shenandoah was a precursor to numerous epic battles of the American Civil War in and around the Potomac and its tributaries, such as the 1861 Battle of Ball's Bluff and the 1862 Battle of Shepherdstown.
Click to expand...
The Wiki about Philadelphia has:
Philadelphia has played an extensive role in United States history. The city was founded in 1682 by William Penn, an English Quaker and advocate of religious freedom, and served as the capital of the Pennsylvania Colony during the colonial era. The city went on to play a historic and vital role during the American Revolution and Revolutionary War, serving as the central meeting place for the nation's founding fathers, hosting the First Continental Congress in 1774, preserving the Liberty Bell, and hosting the Second Continental Congress during which the nation's 56 founders formed the Continental Army and elected George Washington as its commander in 1775, and unanimously adopted the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776. For nine months, from September 1777 to June 1778, the city was occupied by the British during the Philadelphia campaign. In 1787, the U.S. Constitution was ratified in Philadelphia at the Philadelphia Convention. Philadelphia remained the nation's largest city until 1790, and it served as the nation's first capital from May 10, 1775, until December 12, 1776, and on four subsequent occasions until 1800, when construction of the new national capital in Washington, D.C. was completed.
Click to expand...
Etymology of Potomac:
European spelling of an Algonquian name, variously claimed to mean "river of swans", "place where people trade" or "place to which tribute is brought". The natives called the river above the falls Cohongorooton, "river of geese", and that area was renowned in early years for an abundance of both geese and swans. The spelling of the name has been simplified over the years from Patawomeke to Patowmack in the 18th century and now Potomac. The river's name was determined officially as Potomac by the US government's Board on Geographic Names during 1931.
Click to expand...
Etymology of Philadelphia:
The name "Philadelphia" is derived from the Greek words "philadelphia" and "phileo" which mean "love" or "affection" and "brother" or "brotherhood" respectively. It literally translates to "city of brotherly love" or "city of love".

Origin:
The name Philadelphia was first used for the ancient Greek city of Philadelpheia in Asia Minor (present-day Ala≈üehir, Turkey), which was founded in the 3rd century BCE by King Attalus I of Pergamon. The city was named in honor of his brother, Eumenes II.

In 1682, William Penn, the founder of Pennsylvania, chose the name Philadelphia for his planned city in America. He was inspired by the biblical verse in Revelation 3:7-8, which refers to the angel of the church in Philadelphia and emphasizes the importance of brotherly love and faithfulness.

Setting​

The child was treated as an outpatient by the physician who had first diagnosed the child with an autism spectrum disorder.

Participant​

A child with an autism spectrum disorder.

Intervention​

The major intervention was increasing doses of the antifungal drug itraconazole. However, the Sporanox¬Æ brand of itraconazole gave the best results. The child was monitored twice weekly with liver function tests which remained normal throughout the therapy.

Results​

The child had a complete recovery from all the symptoms of autism and in addition developed excellent academic, athletic, and musical skills. The recovery coincided with a marked reduction of urine markers of Aspergillus colonization.

Conclusions​

Escalation of the dose of itraconazole resulted in a complete loss of all symptoms of autism over the course of three months. This rapid complete reversal of autism is consistent with several articles proposing mold in general and Aspergillus specifically as a potential major cause of autism.

In another approach to assess the effects of environmental conditions favorable to mold growth on autism prevalence, two studies were conducted to assess autism prevalence with wet environmental conditions favorable for mold growth. And again, they have like, they're not, they're not people that you'd see in that restaurant, but hey, you know, like anyone can go wherever. But they looked like they were in a biker gang, but they just, their shapes didn't look right. And they ambulated very weird. So when they were walking, it was kind of like this like side to sidewalk, almost like they didn't have an erect spine, you know, but it wasn't just that they were really fat. I don't know. They're almost like a jello person, if that makes sense.

But during this time, you know, we're talking about business stuff and we're like, okay. I just didn't think anything of it. And then we go outside and they also go outside the exact same time as us. It's like, that's weird. These people came in and we were there for probably like an hour. Cause we were just, you know, eating. We go outside this exact same time and they just get in this like really big F-350 jacked up truck and then go away. And then when we were talking about it after, we were like, did you notice that? When they pulled out, they like, the truck turned, but it was like where there wasn't a turnout, if that makes sense?

Jay: There was no way to get out and their truck just disappeared.

Hunter: And it just disappeared. And so it was kind of one of those things when we talked about it later, it was very hazy to us. So like, I'm reporting it back the best of my memory, but I usually don't have like hazy memories. I remember stuff even when I was a child, like very fresh, but it was just weird. And we didn't at the time, but we talked after realizing how bizarre it was because we kind of all felt we were in a haze in the restaurant.

Jay: We were completely drained. Remember on the ride home? So a couple other things you left off that were insane was that we didn't realize until later is that I lost my ATM card and Bobby lost his license. And Laura, as the three of us were driving back to my home, the three of us literally were like, ‚ÄúI'm so tired‚Äù. Like all three of us were like, I feel like we need to just pull over and take a nap.

And we were super energized and had a really productive discussion while we were at this restaurant. But all three of us felt that, but as Hunter saying, we're talking about it now as if we knew what was going on, but we had no idea at the time. It was something that we thought about later because when we were all back home talking about how I lost my ATM card, the other guy who was potentially our business partner lost his license, which he never recovered.

Hunter: He never found his license either and he didn't take it out while he was there or anything - he didn't take it out at all.

Jay: It was the most insane weird thing, but we were sitting there and then all of us just like, like it almost as if it was implanted in our minds. We started talking about the guys and we're like, "weren't they the most bizarre"? Like what really happened? But the thing that freaked me out because I was the one driving and when we tried to leave the parking lot, we let them go because they backed out in front of us, still of course, staring at us. And then they went and as Hunter said, they had this giant jacked up truck. They went straight. And then we started talking amongst ourselves and you know, it was kind of like, okay, I'm gonna let this guy go and then I'll go - and so I went out to follow him but when I went to follow him, we realized because we were in a place that we had never been before in St. Petersburg. We're like, there's no exit.

And then all three of us are like, where did that truck go? Like what? But then we were just kind of like, oh, we must've just lost track of it or whatever. But I'm serious. Like all three of us were in a serious haze. We had our energy drained, which obviously as you know, is what happens when you deal with these beings.

Session 26 November 1994 :

Q: (T) These implants are what they use to control my emotions and amplify them so that they can feed off of them?

A: Not control, influence.

Q: (T) No, not to control; influence. But when, say, I get angry, then I'm angry for a short time but then I'm angry for a long time because they have used this technology to amplify and extend this; is this what they do?

A: Yes. Knowledge protects, ignorance endangers.

Q: (T) Can I feed back through their equipment what I choose?

A: Not necessary.

Q: (T) In other words, if I get angry and realize that I am being more angry than I should be, and I change that to something positive, and feed that back to them while they have their amplifiers wide open, will that affect them? Sour their milk, so to speak?

A: Now you are "fighting fire with fire."

Q: (T) Well, is that something that we are supposed to be doing?

A: Open. But what does phrase imply?

Q: (L) If you feed it back at them, in other words, what they are saying is, I think, when you feel yourself getting angry, the only way to stop the whole thing is to stop being angry and be happy or at peace. When you are happy and at peace there is not in you the desire to send anything back.

A: Bingo.

Q: (J) Redirect the energy into something positive. (F) You can't fight fire with fire. (LM) Well, actually you can in reality. (T) What I am getting at is, is it possible to do that, to change the emotional state to something more positive than what they are expecting and feed that back to them. Is that a possibility?

A: Why.

Q: (T) Just to give them a taste of their own for a change. (J) Do you want to antagonize them? You are still feeding them your energy. (L) The only change you could really have would be the opposite emotion which would be peace and if you are truly feeling peace...

A: 4th density STSers feed off negative energy.

There's confirmation today by Hafez Al-Assad, Bashar Assad's son, that there was no plan to leave Syria.

https://twitter.com/x/status/1888913634807394417

There was never a plan‚Äînot even a backup‚Äîto leave Damascus, let alone Syria.

Over the past 14 years, Syria has endured hardships and dangers no less severe than those of late November and early December. Anyone intending to flee would have done so long ago, particularly in the early years when Damascus faced near siege, daily bombardment, and the constant threat of terrorists reaching its centre.

Before everything unfolded, I travelled from Damascus to Moscow on November 20 via Cham Wings Airlines to defend my doctoral dissertation on November 29. At the time, my mother was in Moscow following a bone marrow transplant she had undergone at the end of summer, which required isolation as part of her treatment. I had planned to stay longer after my defence to complete certain certification procedures, but as the situation in Syria deteriorated, I returned to Damascus on Sunday, December 1, aboard Syrian Air to be with my father and brother, Karim. My mother remained in Moscow to continue her treatment, with my sister, Zein, staying by her side.

Regarding the events of Saturday, December 7, and Sunday, December 8: On Saturday morning, my brother sat for a mathematics exam at the Higher Institute for Applied Sciences and Technology in Damascus, where he was studying. He was preparing to resume classes the next day. Meanwhile, my sister had booked a ticket to return to Damascus on Sunday, December 8, aboard Syrian Air.

On Saturday afternoon, rumours began circulating that we had fled the country. Several people reached out to confirm whether we were still in Damascus. In response, I took a picture at Al-Nairabain Park in Al-Muhajireen neighbourhood and shared it on my (now closed) private Instagram. Not long after, some social media pages picked up the picture and began circulating it.

Until then, despite the distant sounds of shelling, nothing seemed unusual‚Äîjust the familiar reality we had grown accustomed to since the early years of the war. The situation remained unchanged as the army prepared to defend Damascus, showing no signs of the subsequent deterioration‚Äîuntil the sudden and unexpected news of the army‚Äôs withdrawal from Homs, mirroring earlier withdrawals from Hama, Aleppo, and Idlib countryside. Even then, there were no preparations for departure, nor any indication that we would be leaving. That changed after midnight when a Russian official arrived at our home in Al-Malki neighbourhood. He conveyed a request for the President to relocate to Latakia for a few days due to the severity of the situation in Damascus and to facilitate the oversight of the battles, which were still ongoing on the coastal and Al-Ghab Plain fronts.

As for the claim that we left without informing my cousins, who were in Damascus at the time, I was the one who called them multiple times as soon as we knew we were relocating. Shortly afterward, we learned from their household staff that they had left for an unknown destination.

After a short time, we headed toward Damascus International Airport, arriving around 3a.m., where we were joined by my uncle, Maher. We found the airport deserted, with no staff present, including at the control tower. We then boarded a Russian military aircraft to Latakia, landing at Hmeimim Airport before dawn.

In the early hours of Sunday morning, we were supposed to head to the presidential retreat in the Burj Islam area, which is over 40 kilometres from the airport by road. However, all attempts to reach anyone there were unsuccessful, as every phone we tried was turned off. We soon began receiving reports of military withdrawals from the frontlines, and the fall of the last remaining positions. At the same time, a series of drone attacks began targeting the base, accompanied by both close and distant gunfire in the surrounding area; this situation continued throughout our stay.

In the afternoon, the base command briefed us on the gravity of the situation nearby. They informed us that leaving the base was no longer an option, as terrorists had spread through the country, the situation had descended into chaos, and all communication with military leadership had been lost. After consulting with Moscow, the base command informed us that our transfer to Russia had been requested. Some-time after, we boarded a Russian military aircraft bound for Moscow, where we landed later that night.

(Today, the TV mechanism is different - from a media studies perspective, stress is pumped into people, e.g., through infotainment and crime porn, to later sell products as cures for stress. You can take notes and have your spelling checked right away, translate automatically, and check information by clicking. Of course, this replaces your normal brain function. It speeds it up a bit, a bit like cheating. I don't know; there is a subconscious, a thought process, but it's probably like working out in a gym with some light accelerators. The Cassiopaeans have already suggested "thinking XYZ" instead of "Googling XYZ."

I think Internet impacts our use of short-term and long-term memory. Besides, the network largely reflects our neurons, which is why people often lock themselves in their network of neuronal associations, somewhat tamed by the simplified and prosaic media message of people who know how to use it (of course, mainly for financial purposes). But on the other hand, more intelligent people learn faster, exchange information, and are not as susceptible to influence. When they fall into a thought bubble (e.g., socio-political worldview) - it no longer takes them years or decades to work it out; sometimes months are enough.

What was considered conspiracy theories (the so-called "yellow caps" from old YouTube videos or "silver hats") - for many people, also of high social status and objectively intelligent, is information to consider.

After all, we also used encyclopedias, dictionaries, books. Maybe it was simply more at the pace of our brain than the computer? More thoughtful. Then again, we use computers ourselves and we keep up because we use it at our own pace, in our own ways. We can use the computer for research and communication, or for artistic expression, not just funny videos, at our own pace, in our own way. However, at some point the channeling sessions advised us against using the network (as well as using AI, and yet... our curiosity and sense of freedom prevail).

I recently watched a program from the 80s, where people who actually died in an accident later, based on simple electronic devices, predicted the emergence of the "technological man." Maybe not to the extent of Johnny Mnemonic. But basically predicting the mass use of technology, access to information, personal freedom built on it, and, to some extent, the network. I think it is irreversible unless there is a global catalyst. That was AI with some worldview imprinted, with some... thinking. In that sense, it could actually be part of a supervised evolution program, if we look at it from that perspective. If there was a cataclysm, like a global war, there is Starlink. The network was predicted to be indestructible, because it is decentralized - individual transmitters or servers will not shut down the network. Although in the Matrix, there was also an electromagnetic signal that destroyed devices.

Either way, Google is currently losing its importance. It has stopped in time a bit - it overtook website directories, but it did not keep up with AI, and in addition it promoted useless, advertised content, being susceptible to spam. I predict that within a year it will turn into an Application similar to GPT or Grok; otherwise, people will start to use such applications instead of Google instinctively.

As we have already said, the introduction of paid apps would probably destroy the Web, or limit it to "pseudo-elites," who, however, always need an audience, whether for narcissistic reasons or for profit. So it probably won't happen; besides, paying for a subscription or additional options has only partially caught on.

I think we don't have to predict the worst right away. Although we are at a point where it is hard to predict what will happen next. For about 100 years, the world looked pretty much the same. It developed at a multi-year pace. The most optimistic approach is that AI will make things easier for us. Just like the industrial era or access to computers. And the side effects, well. They are marginal, felt by everyone, leveled and inevitable.

Yeah I know what you mean. People notice it. Google promotes commercialized websites. Bing was also like that - but less commercial, more 'gentle'. It becomes like an overlay. Sadly, Google was quite powerful. You could use more advanced research like g something +something -something, or g "this and that". It starts bringing a 'give us the old Google' vibe. I think it was already there when they changed image search.
I think people can get used to using GPT or Grok as their search machine. There was already some fuss over it, like it shows people the results of many sites that can't earn from commercials anymore.
Google isn't yet drowning, but I think they would make it an app.

The possibilities I see are that, for example, Google will promote commerce, but people are annoyed by it. They are annoyed by the eavesdropping that is easy to notice (someone mentions something, and it is displayed to you, although you have never searched for it). They will fail at this, so they will either fall or go in the direction of Bing - almost imperceptible political correctness. Their main advantage, however, was access to information. Whether it will still be needed depends on whether people do not unlearn to search for facts on their own - and I am not even talking about how deep they go, but whether they even try - without interpretation served on a plate.
What if Meta creates its own search engine? And it comes down not only to ads, but also to the state of mind of people you have among your friends. What they recommend, click, read, is promoted at the top. We have already had a certain test called a pandemic. It turned out that the majority of society cannot think differently than the crowd (although there are exceptions who do not admit it). Virtually everyone is subject to this (including social stratification, the position of opinion leader, or insignificant person), so it's an interesting phase of the land of Oz created earlier by TV... or, if to not view it such drastically, just a phase of social development. It's not about "enlightening" everyone with your knowledge. People use things they need. They don't always care about the deep truth. Sometimes it's about sympathy through similarity, easier adaptation. From that point of view, it might be OK. From ours, we might need a better device.

Recently, I asked Grok to "dissect" or criticize Elon Musk. Funnily, it was made to have less political correctness and have sharp language. So it did criticize him quite ruthlessly and very well.
Maybe we should just treat it like a radio show - a journalism, a more or less true or interesting perspective. Simply, one of the possible sources, if you prefer.
